ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.1.3_0: “Venerable Sir, we speak of ‘fracture in the Sangha’.
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.1.4_0: But how is there fracture in the Sangha, yet not schism in the Sangha?
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.1.5_0: But how is there fracture in the Sangha and also schism in the Sangha?”
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.1.6_0: “If, Upāli, there is one monk on one side and two on the other, and a fourth makes the proclamation and distributes voting tickets, saying,
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.1.7_0: ‘This is the Teaching, this is the Monastic Law, this is the Teacher’s instruction; take this, approve of this,’
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.1.8_0: then this is a fracture in the Sangha, but not schism in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.1.9_0: If there are two monks on one side and two on the other, and a fifth makes the proclamation and distributes voting tickets, saying,
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.1.10_0: ‘This is the Teaching, this is the Monastic Law, this is the Teacher’s instruction; take this, approve of this,’
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.1.11_0: then this is a fracture in the Sangha, but not schism in the Sangha.

ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.1.14_0: then this is a fracture in the Sangha, but not schism in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.1.15_0: If there are three monks on one side and three on the other, and an makes the proclamation and distributes voting tickets, saying,

ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.1.17_0: then this is a fracture in the Sangha, but not schism in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.1.18_0: If there are three monks on one side and four on the other, and an eighth makes the proclamation and distributes voting tickets, saying,
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.1.19_0: ‘This is the Teaching, this is the Monastic Law, this is the Teacher’s instruction; take this, approve of this,’
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.1.20_0: then this is a fracture in the Sangha, but not schism in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.1.21_0: If there are four monks on one side and four on the other, and an eighth makes the proclamation and distributes voting tickets, saying,
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.1.22_0: ‘This is the Teaching, this is the Monastic Law, this is the Teacher’s instruction; take this, approve of this,’
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.1.23_0: then there is a fracture in the Sangha and also a schism in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.1.24_0: And if there are nine or more monks, then this is both a fracture in the Sangha and also a schism in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.1.25_0: A nun cannot cause a schism in the Sangha, even if she makes an effort to cause a schism. A trainee nun,
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.1.26_0: a novice monk, a novice nun, a male lay follower, or a female lay follower cannot cause a schism in the Sangha, even if she makes an effort to cause a schism.
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.1.27_0: Only a monk of regular standing, one who belongs to the same Buddhist sect and is present within the same monastic boundary, can cause a schism in the Sangha.”
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.2.1_0: “Venerable Sir, we speak of ‘schism in the Sangha’.
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.2.2_0: How is schism in the Saṅgha defined?”
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.2.3_0: “Take the case when monks proclaim what is contrary to the Teaching as the Teaching.
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.2.4_0: They proclaim what is the Teaching as contrary to the Teaching.
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.2.5_0: They proclaim what is contrary to the Monastic Law as the Monastic Law.
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.2.6_0: They proclaim what is the Monastic Law as contrary to the Monastic Law.
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.2.7_0: They proclaim what hasn’t been spoken by the Buddha as spoken by the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.2.8_0: They proclaim what has been spoken by the Buddha as not spoken by the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.2.9_0: They proclaim what was not practiced by the Buddha as practiced by the Buddha.

ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.2.11_0: They proclaim what was not laid down by the Buddha as laid down by the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.2.12_0: and what was prescribed by the Realized One as not prescribed by the Realized One.
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.2.13_0: They proclaim a non-offense as an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.2.14_0: They proclaim an offense as a non-offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.2.15_0: They proclaim a light offense as heavy.
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.2.16_0: They proclaim a heavy offense as light.
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.2.17_0: They proclaim a curable offense as incurable.
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.2.18_0: They proclaim an incurable offense as curable.
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.2.19_0: They proclaim a grave offense as minor.
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.2.20_0: They proclaim a minor offense as grave.
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.2.21_0: If, based on any of these eighteen grounds, they pull away or separate, and they do the observance-day procedure, the invitation procedure, and the legal procedures of the Sangha separately,
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.2.22_0: That is how schism in the Saṅgha is defined.”

ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.4.1_0: “But, Sir, what is the consequence of causing a schism in a united Sangha?”
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.4.2_0: “Anyone who causes a schism in a united Sangha does a bad act with effect for an eon; he’s boiled in hell for an eon.
ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.4.4_0: in a place of loss, in hell.

ai-pli-tv-kd17:5.4.9_0: “But sir, what does someone who has created harmony in a schismatic Saṅgha bring upon themselves?”
